text: in this video you'll see how to collect
evidence and manage audit data using aws
audit manager
with this service you can proactively
prepare for audits by continuously
tracking your aws usage and creating
audit ready reports
aws audit manager helps you continuously
audit your aws usage to simplify how you
assess
risk and compliance with regulations and
industry standards
to get started let's navigate to control
tower and get the account information
we'll need to set up audit manager
we'll designate the audit account as a
delegated administrator for audit
manager
let's open the account details and copy
the account id
next navigate to the audit manager
console to set up audit manager
enter the audit account id and then
click delegate
since we are currently logged into the
management account we will only specify
the delegated admins account id
the delegated admin can customize the
settings later let's complete the setup
now let's log into the audit account to
switch to the perspective of the
delegated admin
launch audit manager and customize its
settings
by default aws encrypts data in audit
manager with kms
using a generated key you can optionally
provide your own kms key or create
another
here you can provide aws identity and
access management
iam roles with access to assessment data
by default
you can optionally designate an amazon
simple storage service amazon s3 bucket
as a default target for reports you can
also designate an amazon simple
notification service amazon sns
topic for all report notifications
you can also set up aws config and
security hub to generate evidence from
config rules and security findings
config is already enabled through
control tower let's enable security hub
now let's save the audit manager
settings and navigate to the framework
library
a framework serves as a template for
assessments specifying the config rules
that must be followed for assessments to
pass
as well as other settings such as how
often audit updates are performed
we'll use the aws control tower guard
rails framework as a starting point for
our assessment
it consists of five control sets which
are groupings of different config rules
follow the steps to create the
assessment first specify the assessment
details
next specify which aws accounts to
include in the scope of the assessment
since this assessment is created from a
standard framework audit manager
automatically maps and selects the data
sources and services in scope
let's continue to the next step
next we'll select all roles in our
account as audit owners
next review the configuration and create
the assessment
audit manager will automatically start
collecting evidence which can
take up to 24 hours let's skip ahead to
when this process is complete
you can see the control sets as well as
their status delegation
total evidence and the amount of
evidence added to the assessment report
you can expand a control set to see each
related control and its status
let's dive deeper into the first control
set
the status of each control is under
review
let's look at the details for the second
control
from here you can update the control
status upload custom evidence
view the data source provide comments
and view the change log
the evidence folder has a compliance
issue let's add the evidence to the
assessment report and then take a closer
look at the issue
the most recent evidence is
non-compliant
here you can view details about the
evidence including its attributes
event name and resources
you can also view the json output
now let's return to the control tower
guard rails page to complete the control
set review
let's skip ahead to after we've
completed this process for all five
control sets
now that we've finished reviewing all
the control sets in our assessment we're
ready to generate an assessment report
reports can be generated continuously
for the same or different resources on a
scheduled basis
let's download our report and take a
look at it
the folder for the generated report
contains a pdf with a summary of the
compliance of each control set
as well as subfolders containing the
corresponding control set data
let's take a look at the pdf
let's view the compliance of the first
control set
you've just seen how to collect evidence
and manage audit data using aws audit
manager
you can learn more about this topic in
the description and links for this video
thanks for watching now it's your turn
to try
